Name: Epic of the Blazing Sun - Chapter I
StateKeyPattern: 剧情_2_5_七丘主线_下半间章_6_1

Chapters.Title: Epic of the Blazing Sun - Chapter I

Dialogues.Speaker: Nestor
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Dear guest from afar, do follow me into the near-forgotten stories of Augusta. But simply telling it might be a bit dull.

Options.PlotLineKey: What methods do you have in mind?
What are you trying to do?

Dialogues.Speaker: Nestor
Dialogues.PlotLineKey:
Perhaps, having the listener become the protagonist of such stories might be a good option.
This should add a more "immersive" touch to the sounds and images you've yet to hear and see.

Dialogues.Speaker: Nestor
Dialogues.PlotLineKey:
At this moment, you are Augusta.
You shall relive her past. Face the same choices she once made.
Thus... please forget your name for now.

Dialogues.Speaker: Nestor
Dialogues.PlotLineKey:
Of course, Augusta's story is already written.
No matter what choices you'd make, they will not alter our reality.

Dialogues.Speaker: Nestor
Dialogues.PlotLineKey:
Yet, be wary. Fate is fickle, and a misstep can lead to a swift end.
Weigh your choices carefully.

Options.PlotLineKey: Her past decisions may not have always been the best.

Dialogues.Speaker: Nestor
Dialogues.PlotLineKey:
Well, then. Let the story begin.
Set aside the complex thoughts,
and let me sing the epic of a young girl—Augusta.

Options.PlotLineKey: I am Augusta. I am Augusta.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey:
A gentle, warm light begins to blur your vision, and you slowly close your eyes... When it clears, a small, frightened girl clutching a sword stands amidst the ruins.
A group of solemn Septimontian Gladiators stands guard around her.

Dialogues.Speaker: Gladiator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey:
"Hey, kid, are you alone?
Don't be afraid. We know what the Dark Tide did to your home,
and we're here to help."

Options.PlotLineKey: Boldly observe the man in front of you.
Timidly observe the man in front of you.

Dialogues.Speaker: Gladiator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: "You must be hungry. Here, this should be enough to keep you from starving for now."

Options.PlotLineKey: Take the food offered by the Gladiator.
Refuse the food offered by the Gladiator.

Dialogues.Speaker: Gladiator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey:
"We can take you to Septimont City.
It's not safe here. We don't know when the next disaster will strike.
Staring at these ruins won't change anything."

Dialogues.Speaker: Gladiator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey:
"Even if you rebuild these walls a thousand times,
they'll never hold against the Dark Tide.
You don't have the strength to stop it.
Bring your sword and come with us..."

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Gladiators shake their heads and pat your shoulder.

Options.PlotLineKey: Look back at the ruined village.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey:
In the end, you chose to leave the village.
The Gladiators' words revealed a bitter truth: you lacked the strength to protect the home you are leaving behind.
In your travels, you...

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey:
Following the Gladiators, you arrive in the City of Septimont by ship.
You wave them goodbye after arriving at the central square.
Meanwhile, you notice the square is crowded with citizens.

Options.PlotLineKey: Show your awe of the city.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey:
A poster for the Gladiator's Agon is pinned to a wooden board.
The air is filled with heated chatter about the upcoming match.

Options.PlotLineKey: The gathering people push you towards the crowd.

Dialogues.Speaker: Septimontian Onlookers
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: "You must know, Septimont reveres strength. Here, only the victor reigns. That is a law older than the city itself."

Options.PlotLineKey: You notice the passion-filled eyes of this Septimontian.
You notice the disdain in the eyes of this Septimontian.

Dialogues.Speaker: Septimontian Onlookers
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Eat or be eaten, such is the way of this city. To survive, you'll have to find your bite and seize the crown with your own teeth.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey:
You can't stop thinking about their conversation.
You realize that Gladiators are the very symbol of strength in Septimont.
If there's a way to dominate the arena, maybe you'll find the strength you're looking for...

Options.PlotLineKey: Tear down the poster and walk away from the crowd.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey:
As you leave, you notice that three words stand out in the incessant chatter: identity, status, and talent.
They seem to be an essential part of gladiating.

Dialogues.Speaker: Arrogant Septimontian
Dialogues.PlotLineKey:
"There are always those commoners who view the Agon as mere boring displays of butchery.
But we're hardly entertained by the sight of rats shrieking in the dirt.
What we crave is true magnificence, a warrior who can make roses bloom from blood."

Dialogues.Speaker: Cold Septimontian
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: "Wanna have a little bet on how many mangy rats are gonna try for the Agon this year? Them and their stench be stinking up the place."

Options.PlotLineKey: You're slightly concerned about your status and talents.

Dialogues.Speaker: Nestor
Dialogues.PlotLineKey:
You are determined to step onto the arena.
The rules demand a mentor at your back.
Someone to keep death from claiming you on the first day, and perhaps even teach you to see the fight through to the end.

Dialogues.Speaker: Nestor
Dialogues.PlotLineKey:
After hitting several dead ends, you eventually come across Cato.
Cato is a retired Gladiator star but takes on few proteges.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cato
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: "So you want to join the Agon, you say? Why don't you start by telling me a little about yourself?"

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey:
You recall the discussions about Gladiators—identity, status, and talents. People in the city of Septimont seem to value these more than anything.
You choose to...

Dialogues.Speaker: Cato
Dialogues.PlotLineKey:
"The Dark Tide took your home, and you came to Septimont seeking strength. Is that so?
You've got some mettle, but that's not gonna cut it here."

Dialogues.Speaker: Cato
Dialogues.PlotLineKey:
"Go home. People like you always show up with nothing but fancy dreams, only to see them crushed and trampled.
I've seen enough of idiots like you."

Dialogues.Speaker: Cato
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: "What now? Still here, are you? You think your stubbornness will change my mind? Pathetic."

Options.PlotLineKey: Look Cato straight in the eye.
Tighten your grip on the sword.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cato
Dialogues.PlotLineKey:
"Alright then, let's have a duel. Land one strike and you win.
If you manage that, I'll teach you how to be a true Gladiator.
This duel here is your entrance trial."

Options.PlotLineKey: Accept the duel after great deliberation.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey:
Blades meet in a sharp clash. Cato moves with practiced ease.
You are quickly defeated.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cato
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: "Strengthless. Do you realize how weak you are?"

Options.PlotLineKey: Which is why I am seeking power.
Which is why I want to become a Gladiator.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cato
Dialogues.PlotLineKey:
"Heh, do you really know who you're fighting against?
Can you really best me?
You can't. Now, how do you plan to end this?"

Options.PlotLineKey: Challenge him again the next day.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cato
Dialogues.PlotLineKey:
"Back for Round two, are we?
Country rats like you sure are as pestering as the city folks say you are, huh?"

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey:
Just like last time, you aren't much of a challenge to Cato.
You are swiftly beaten once again.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cato
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: "Go back. This is not your path..."

Options.PlotLineKey: Continue the challenge on the third day.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cato
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: "Too slow, too weak... Your foolish swings only bring smiles to your enemies."

Dialogues.Speaker: Cato
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: "Is that your best? How naive. Well, I guess a rat that lives in the dark is never meant for the sun. Checkmate. You've lost."

Options.PlotLineKey: Challenge him again on the fourth day.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cato
Dialogues.PlotLineKey:
"Still not ready to give up? Why don't you sell your sword?
It'll get you some food at least."

Options.PlotLineKey: Continue the challenge on the fifth day.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You stand before Cato again. Dragging your exhausted body, nearly at your limit.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey:
The wind swept up by the blade whispers past,
and you're suddenly home.
Soft sunlight cascades on the great oak's leaves, and you hear your friends' laughter, your parents' gentle calls.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey:
But in the very next breath, a bone-deep chill engulfs you.
That touch, you know it all too well.
Thoughts race across your mind, and your hand instinctively gripped the sword hilt.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You seize the opening and land a hit on Cato.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Cato hands you his sword and turns to leave...

Options.PlotLineKey: Catch Cato's sword. It's rather heavy.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cato
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: "In Septimont's arena, the victor claims the weapon of the defeated, a symbol of conquest. This sword is yours now..."

Dialogues.Speaker: Cato
Dialogues.PlotLineKey:
"If you are determined to bite off that crown,
do not fall before you get there.
Augusta, that's your name, isn't it?"

Dialogues.Speaker: Cato
Dialogues.PlotLineKey:
"The moment you step into the arena, you will lose this name.
The spectators may brand you with a number, a symbol, or even the name of some wild beast."

Dialogues.Speaker: Cato
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: And only the last one standing has the right to reclaim their true name.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cato
Dialogues.PlotLineKey:
"By then, all will be chanting your name—Augusta.
You'll have to conquer their hearts and win their applause even without identity, status, and talents.
Tell me, will I see that day?"

Options.PlotLineKey: I will make the crowd cheer.
I will make them know my true name.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cato
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Training starts tomorrow. Six sharp. Right here.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: A girl whose homeland was devastated by the Dark Tide, Augusta, follows Septimont's Gladiators to the city. Her heart yearns to find the power to protect her home, and the crowd's buzz of the Great Agon catches her attention. The girl thinks this path may help her find the strength she is seeking, so she is determined to participate in the Agon. According to the rules, she needs a mentor. With no identity or status, she faces repeated setbacks until she finally finds Cato as her "lifeline." The girl continues to hone her skills, passing the entry trials Cato set for her, and finally makes her first step into the Agon.
